intro: Zaluzianskya glandulosa, commonly known as the stickyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Zaluzianskya glandulosa is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant.
